body:
**Changes by Iuri de Silvio ([@iurisilvio](https://github.com/iurisilvio)):**

* edited description

**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

Handle `SSL error: decryption failed or bad record mac`

This is another psycopg2 error message representing an
unusable connection.

Fixes #3715
Change-Id: Ida6e212963e9c7336bf2944e7ef928619ac3a0e7
Pull-request: https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/pull-requests/85

issue.title: psycopg2 unhandled SSL SYSCALL error: Bad address

labels.name: easy
labels.description: a one / two  liner type of thing that anyone can do in short order. also see "fairly easy"

labels.name: PRs (with tests!) welcome
labels.description: a fix or feature which is appropriate to be implemented by volunteers

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

A connection returns `SSL SYSCALL error: Bad address` and gets into a bad state,
but it remains in the pool and continues to throw a series of
`DatabaseError: (psycopg2.DatabaseError) error with status PGRES_TUPLES_OK and no message from the libpq (Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/4xp6)`
errors until the entire container dies.

This may be a similar error to https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/3715

**Expected behavior**

The connection should be considered disconnected and taken out of the pool.
Should all `SSL SYSCALL`s be considered for disconnect? It seems like there's
a selection here:
https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/blob/58ea811/lib/sqlalchemy/dialects/postgresql/psycopg2.py#L969

**Initial Error**

```
...
  File "/src/benchling/configs/config_override.py", line 26, in get_all_tenant_configs
    return tenant.config_overrides
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/attributes.py", line 275, in __get__
    return self.impl.get(instance_state(instance), dict_)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/attributes.py", line 674, in get
    value = self.callable_(state, passive)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/strategies.py", line 708, in _load_for_state
    session, state, primary_key_identity, passive
  File "/src/benchling/lib/sqla_ext/session_eager_loader.py", line 189, in _emit_lazyload
    return super(SessionEagerLoader, self)._emit_lazyload(session, state, ident_key, passive)
  File "<string>", line 1, in <lambda>
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/strategies.py", line 850, in _emit_lazyload
    .with_post_criteria(set_default_params)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/baked.py", line 477, in all
    return list(self)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/baked.py", line 380, in __iter__
    return q._execute_and_instances(context)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/query.py", line 3106, in _execute_and_instances
    result = conn.execute(querycontext.statement, self._params)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 980, in execute
    return meth(self, multiparams, params)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/sql/elements.py", line 273, in _execute_on_connection
    return connection._execute_clauseelement(self, multiparams, params)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1099, in _execute_clauseelement
    distilled_params,
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1240, in _execute_context
    e, statement, parameters, cursor, context
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1458, in _handle_dbapi_exception
    util.raise_from_cause(sqlalchemy_exception, exc_info)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/util/compat.py", line 296, in raise_from_cause
    reraise(type(exception), exception, tb=exc_tb, cause=cause)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1236, in _execute_context
    cursor, statement, parameters, context
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 536, in do_execute
    cursor.execute(statement, parameters)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ddtrace/contrib/dbapi/__init__.py", line 91, in execute
    return self._trace_method(self.__wrapped__.execute, self._self_datadog_name, query, {}, query, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ddtrace/contrib/psycopg/patch.py", line 51, in _trace_method
    return super(Psycopg2TracedCursor, self)._trace_method(method, name, resource, extra_tags, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ddtrace/contrib/dbapi/__init__.py", line 61, in _trace_method
    return method(*args, **kwargs)
DatabaseError: (psycopg2.DatabaseError) SSL SYSCALL error: Bad address
```

**Subsequent errors**
```
...

    reraise(type(exception), exception, tb=exc_tb, cause=cause)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 731, in _rollback_impl
    self.engine.dialect.do_rollback(self.connection)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 486, in do_rollback
    dbapi_connection.rollback()
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ddtrace/contrib/dbapi/__init__.py", line 189, in rollback
    return self._trace_method(self.__wrapped__.rollback, span_name, {}, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ddtrace/contrib/dbapi/__init__.py", line 174, in _trace_method
    return method(*args, **kwargs)
DatabaseError: (psycopg2.DatabaseError) error with status PGRES_TUPLES_OK and no message from the libpq (Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/4xp6)
    util.raise_from_cause(sqlalchemy_exception, exc_info)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/util/compat.py", line 296, in raise_from_cause

  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 731, in _rollback_impl

  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 486, in do_rollback
    dbapi_connection.rollback()
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ddtrace/contrib/dbapi/__init__.py", line 189, in rollback

  File "/opt/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ddtrace/contrib/dbapi/__init__.py", line 174, in _trace_method
    return method(*args, **kwargs)
DatabaseError: (psycopg2.DatabaseError) error with status PGRES_TUPLES_OK and no message from the libpq (Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/4xp6)
```

**Versions**
 - OS: Amazon Linux 2
 - Python: 2.7.17
 - SQLAlchemy: 1.2.17
 - Database: RDS postgres 9.6.9
 - DBAPI:

body:
Dear SQLalchemy community,

I am facing an intermittent error that ends with
```
psycopg2.OperationalError: SSL error:
decryption failed or bad record mac
```

I see  something *similar* was reported above on this thread,  but the traceback error I am getting is different. The comments above suggest the issue was a sqlalchemy bug that was eventually solved in 2016.

Below I attach the full traceback log, which doesn't point to my application code. Would you have any suggestions?
Thank you,
Temok

```log
ERROR:base.py:Line 705:_finalize_fairy:Exception during reset or similar

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/tsalazar/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/ufos--PZ7y9g--py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/pool/base.py", line 697, in _finalize_fairy
    fairy._reset(pool)

  File "/home/tsalazar/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/ufos--PZ7y9g--py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/pool/base.py", line 893, in _reset
    pool._dialect.do_rollback(self)

  File "/home/tsalazar/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/ufos--PZ7y9g--py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 558, in do_rollback
    dbapi_connection.rollback()

psycopg2.OperationalError: SSL error: decryption failed or bad record mac
```

Hi,

it's probably best to open a new issue. The problem seems indeed similar to above
